de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface WizardDialogDecorator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WizardDialog, WizardDialogDecorator

    public interface WizardDialogDecorator
    Defines the interface a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierary of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provides a navigation for switching between multiple fragments, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

      • getViewPager

        android.support.v4.view.ViewPager getViewPager()
        Returns the view pager, which is contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The view pager, which is contained by the dialog, as an instance of the class ViewPager or null, if the dialog does not show any fragments or has not been shown yet

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass,
                 @Nullable
                 Bundle arguments)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        arguments - A bundle, which should be passed to the fragment, when it is shown, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no arguments should be passed to the fragment

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@StringRes
                 int resourceId,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the title of the fragment, which should be added, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@StringRes
                 int resourceId,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass,
                 @Nullable
                 Bundle arguments)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the title of the fragment, which should be added, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        arguments - A bundle, which should be passed to the fragment, when it is shown, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no arguments should be passed to the fragment

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@Nullable
                 java.lang.CharSequence title,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no title should be set
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null

      • addFragment

        void addFragment(@Nullable
                 java.lang.CharSequence title,
                 @NonNull
                 java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass,
                 @Nullable
                 Bundle arguments)
        Adds a new fragment to the dialog.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no title should be set
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        arguments - A bundle, which should be passed to the fragment, when it is shown, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no arguments should be passed to the fragment

        Removes all fragments from the dialog.

      • indexOfFragment

        int indexOfFragment(@NonNull
                    java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass)
        Returns the index of a specific fragment.
        Parameters:
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, whose index should be returned, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the given fragment as an Integer value or -1, if the adapter does not contain the given fragment

      • getFragmentCount

        int getFragmentCount()
        Returns the number of fragments, which are contained by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The number of fragments, which are contained by the dialog, as an Integer value

      • getTabPosition

        WizardDialog.TabPosition getTabPosition()
        Returns the position of the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment.
        Returns:
        The position of the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, as a value of the enum WizardDialog.TabPosition

      • setTabPosition

        void setTabPosition(@NonNull
                    WizardDialog.TabPosition tabPosition)
        Sets the position of the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment.
        Parameters:
        tabPosition - The position, which should be set, as a value of the enum WizardDialog.TabPosition. The position may either be USE_HEADER, PREFER_HEADER or NO_HEADER

      • isTabLayoutEnabled

        boolean isTabLayoutEnabled()
        Returns, whether the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, are enabled, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, are enabled, false otherwise

      • enableTabLayout

        void enableTabLayout(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment. When the tabs are enabled, it is possible to switch between the fragments by clicking the tabs.
        Parameters:
        enable - True, if the tabs should be enabled, false otherwise

      • isTabLayoutShown

        boolean isTabLayoutShown()
        Returns, whether the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, are shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, are shown, false otherwise

      • showTabLayout

        void showTabLayout(boolean show)
        Sets, whether the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, should be shown shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the tabs, which indicate the currently shown fragment, should be shown, false otherwise

      • getTabIndicatorHeight

        int getTabIndicatorHeight()
        Returns the height of the indicator, which indicates the currently shown fragment.
        Returns:
        The height of the indicator, which indicates the currently shown fragment, in pixels as an Integer value

      • setTabIndicatorHeight

        void setTabIndicatorHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the indicator, which indicates the currently shown fragment.
        Parameters:
        height - The height, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value. The height must be at least 1
